content.description: A capacitor made from two parallel, circular metal plates is connected to a source of constant <math alttext="e m f" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"> <mi>emf</mi> </math> <math alttext="script uppercase E" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>∆ê</mi></math>, as shown in the figure. Each plate has area <math alttext="A" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>A</mi></math>, and the two plates are separated in air by a distance <math alttext="s" overflow="scroll" xmlns="http://www.w3.org/1998/Math/MathML"><mi>s</mi></math> that can be varied, but is always small compared to the size of the plates.
content.question: Which graph best represents the magnitude <math alttext="E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>E</mi></math> of the electric field between the plates as a function of the separation distance <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math>?

choices.label: The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled s and the vertical axis is labeled E. The line begins to the right of the top of the vertical axis and moves horizontally to the right, ending high above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a line in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled s and the vertical axis is labeled E. The line begins just upward and to the right of the origin, slants upward and to the right, and ends high above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled s and the vertical axis is labeled E. The curve begins to the right of the vertical axis and just above the horizontal axis, and moves upward and to the right slowly at first and then more rapidly, and ends high above the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled s and the vertical axis is labeled E. The curve begins to the right of the vertical axis and high above the horizontal axis, and moves downward and to the right, levelling off as it does. It ends near the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

content.answer: The figure shows the graph of a curve in the first quadrant of a coordinate plane, with the origin labeled O. The horizontal axis is labeled s and the vertical axis is labeled E. The curve begins to the right of the vertical axis and high above the horizontal axis, and moves downward and to the right, levelling off as it does. It ends near the horizontal axis and far to the right of the vertical axis.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
